artifact.content: Users should be able to send calls.
Users should be able to receive calls.
A successful call establishes an audio connection.
A user can make a call outside of the system by dialing 9.
The system must maintain a mapping of dialed numbers to IP addresses and ports.
Phone numbers/extensions are 4 digits long.
A user should be able to leave a voice mail message if a line is busy or the callee doesn�t answer after some time.
The system shall send the caller a descriptive error message if a call cannot be made.
Upon successful connection, system allocate resources to that connection
Upon disconnection, system deallocates the resources assigned to a connection.
A user can call the administrator by dialing 0.
A user can enter the special features menu by dialing * to have the features described or dialing *XX to enter the menu for a specific feature (where XX is the menu code for that feature menu).
User should be able to access his/her voice mail box at anytime.
User should be able to delete or save new or archive messages.
System saves the voice mail of each user in their voice box.
An administrator is able to add a user to the system from the system console with user information including: name, employee ID, home phone number, and address.
An administrator can set user account privileges from the console including: originate calls, receive calls, and voice mail.
An administrator can cancel a user�s phone service from the console by disassociating the IP and phone from the user account and from the mapping.
The System deletes the voice messages of the phone that is canceled by the administrator.
User records should be retained indefinitely.
An administrator can change a users phone privileges at any time through the console.
An administrator can search the user accounts in the system console based on name or employee ID.
An administrator can edit the user accounts in the system console.
Administrator sends out the bills to departments for user�s specific period of usage.
System keeps track of the user�s call minutes and the time the connection was established and the type of the calls
Upon receiving the money from the user, the system can changes the account balance to zero
If the user pays more than his account balance, the system saves the amount for the next payment.
System can save the billing account from previous balance and add it to the current balance.
Administrator should be able to view the status of the IP phones connected to the system.
Administrator should be able to reset any phones at any time.
Administrator should be able to test any or all the phones at any time.
Administrator should be able to set the maximum number of lines in the system.
Administrator can view the load of the system.
Each time a connection cannot be made, the error message generated by the system will be saved in error log.
If an IPPhone does not response, the system suspends the phone.
System must detect the new added IPPhone
System allows the administrator to remove an IPPhone.
Any Administrator with knowledge of computer and IP Phone system must be able to use the User Console.
Easy to use menus and voice error messages when error occurs during calls.
Consistent with other phone systems, so anyone who has used a phone can use an IP Phone.
System must be up at all times
Administrators� password and the users� mailbox passwords must be secured from the other users.
